Class StopIfNoImprovementRegime

java.lang.Object
net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.regimes.DelegatedRegime
net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.regimes.StopIfNoImprovementRegime
All Implemented Interfaces:
Regime
@Strategy(CONCRETE) public class StopIfNoImprovementRegime extends DelegatedRegime
A Regime decorator that implements early stopping based on lack of improvement in the objective (loss).

This regime monitors the relative improvement in loss between epochs using an ObjectiveReportingRegime. If the improvement falls below a configured threshold for more than getMaxStalledEpochs() epochs in a row, training is terminated early. This prevents wasting time on epochs that do not lead to meaningful progress.

Behavior

  • Wraps the delegate regime with an ObjectiveReportingRegime if it is not already one.
  • Each call to train(E, net.tvburger.jdl.model.DataSet, net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.ObjectiveFunction, net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.Optimizer<? super E>) checks the last recorded relative improvement.
  • If the improvement is greater than the configured getMinImprovement(), the stall counter is reset to zero.
  • If the improvement is less than or equal to the threshold, the stall counter is incremented.
  • If the stall counter exceeds getMaxStalledEpochs(), the train(E, net.tvburger.jdl.model.DataSet, net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.ObjectiveFunction, net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.Optimizer<? super E>) call returns immediately and terminated is set to true.
See Also:
  • ObjectiveReportingRegime
  • DelegatedRegime

  • Method Details

    • create

      @StaticFactory public static StopIfNoImprovementRegime create(Regime regime, int maxStalledEpochs, float minImprovement, boolean dumpLosses)
      Static factory for creating a StopIfNoImprovementRegime.

      If the given regime is not already an ObjectiveReportingRegime, it will be wrapped in one to measure loss improvements. Optionally, loss values can be dumped to the console.

      Parameters:
      regime - the underlying regime to delegate to
      maxStalledEpochs - maximum consecutive epochs with insufficient improvement before stopping
      minImprovement - minimum relative improvement threshold (percentage) to be considered progress
      dumpLosses - whether to print loss values during training
      Returns:
      a configured StopIfNoImprovementRegime

      public <E extends EstimationFunction> void train(E estimationFunction, DataSet trainingSet, ObjectiveFunction objective, Optimizer<? super E> optimizer)
      Trains the model, but stops early if there has been insufficient improvement in the last getMaxStalledEpochs() epochs.
      Type Parameters:
      E - the type of estimation function
      Parameters:
      estimationFunction - the model to train
      trainingSet - the dataset to train on
      objective - the objective (loss) function
      optimizer - the optimizer to apply updates

      Resets the internal counters and terminated flag so this regime can be reused for a new training run.
